thread.title: First Financial Credit Union Player of the Week Awards
thread.title_full: First Financial Credit Union Player of the Week Awards

title: First Financial Credit Union Player of the Week Awards
text:
First Financial Credit Union Player of the Week Awards Kyle Henderson NMPreps.com Editor 
Each week on NMPreps.com we select a North, Metro Area, Southwest, and Southeast Player of the Week. The Player of the week award is powered by First Financial Credit Union. 
NMPreps.com's Week 8 Coach of the Week - David Howes of Rio Rancho Did you know that Rio Rancho High School is 19-1 against New Mexico competition over the last two seasons? Last week the Rams moved to 6-2 and 2-0 in district play with a thrilling win over Volcano Vista 36-34. Head Coach David Howes now in his 7th season at Rio Rancho has taken the Rams to new heights program wise and there is no signs of slowing down. The Rams take on Cibola High School Thursday Night in another marquee district 1-6A match up. 
NMPreps.com's Week 8 Team of the Week: Sandia Matadors Last Friday Night the Sandia Matadors saved their season and saved their playoff hopes with a 17-12 victory over the high flying Eldorado Eagles to shake up the 6A playoff picture. The Matador's put together a great defensive game plan and held Eldorado a team which was scoring 45.5 points per game entering week 8 to just 10 points (Sandia took a safety late in the game). The Matadors now 5-3 and 1-1 in district play take on La Cueva in week 9. Mark Flores had 10 tackles, Carter Phillips ran for a touchdown, Paul Rosales kicked a field goal, Jacob Archibeque had a good night passing, and Jimmy Galleogs ran for a touchdown. 
North Player of the Week - Marcos Flores - Espanola The perfect season is still alive as the Espanola Valley Sundevils improved to 7-0 on the season defeating Del Norte 40-18 in week 8. Flores a senior at Espanola scored three times on the night and has been a threat to go the distance anytime he touches the football. On the season Flores has rushed for 625-yards rushing with 8 touchdowns. The Sundevils are on the road this weekend against Los Alamos. 
Metro Player of the Week - Steve Bailey - Rio Rancho In a thriller the Rio Rancho Rams defeated the Volcano Vista Hawks 36-34. Senior Quarterback Steven Bailey threw a 43-yard hail mary which turned into a game winning touchdown catch by sophomore Derrick Reyes as time expired. Bailey threw three touchdowns on the night helping the Ram's pick up a very important district win, likely securing a home playoff game down the stretch. On the season Bailey has thrown for 1,761-yards and has a touchdown/interception ratio of 13/4. The Rams are in action this Thursday against Cibola. 
Southwest Player of the Week - Forest McKee - Onate Last Friday Night the Onate Knights improved to 3-5 and 1-1 in district after 37-6 victory over the Deming Wildcats keeping their playoff hopes well alive. The first score for the Knights came off a 40+ yard touchdown run by Onate Junior Forest McKee who checks in at 6-foot-0, 210 pounds. McKee finished with 141-yards off 19 carries and scored 2 touchdowns, he also had 10 tackles on defense. The Knights take on Gadsden Friday Night. 
Southeast Player of the Week - Kyle Idtensohn - Ft. Sumner The Ft. Sumner Foxes moved to 5-3 on the season after a 49-26 victory over Loving in week 8. Senior Running Back Kyle Idtensohn has been having an impressive season weekly, but Friday he reeled off 353-yards and scored 5 touchdowns against the Falcons. This week Ft. Sumner takes on Hagerman in a district game. Talk about it in NEW MEXICO PREP FOOTBALL INSIDER FEATURED PRODUCTS
